profile.name: Nihar Patel
profile.headline: Software engineer focused on distributed systems, cloud platforms, and full-stack delivery.
profile.bio: I build scalable backend systems, data pipelines, and developer facing platforms with a focus on reliability, performance, and clean interfaces. My recent work spans distributed systems (Go, Java, C++), cloud platforms (GCP and AWS), and full-stack product delivery with React and Next.js.

projects.title: Real-Time News Analysis and Alert Platform
projects.summary: Event-driven news pipeline that enriches articles with LLM insights, deduplicates content, and sends personalized alerts in near real time.
highlights: Built Python LLM enrichment pipeline with semantic deduplication and dynamic topic clustering using pgvector, reducing LLM API calls by 60% while processing 10K+ daily articles.
Developed Go notification microservice with Redis caching and topic-based clustering, matching user preferences and reducing duplicate alerts by 70% with sub-2-minute latency.
Designed event-driven microservices architecture with Kafka stream processing, PostgreSQL, and Next.js frontend, containerized with Docker and deployed on AWS ECS.
projects.details: A streaming platform that ingests news, enriches it with AI, deduplicates similar items, and triggers user alerts based on preferences.

projects.title: Distributed Job Orchestration Platform
projects.summary: Fault-tolerant job orchestrator with a Java control plane, Go worker agents, and Etcd-backed coordination for scheduling containerized workloads.
highlights: Built fault-tolerant Java control plane with Etcd consensus and consistent hashing, scheduling 10,000+ jobs across dynamic nodes and maintaining availability during network partitions.
Implemented Go worker agents using Linux cgroups to isolate resources and run containers securely in production.
Shipped Prometheus metrics and Grafana dashboards for real-time health, utilization, and alerting globally at scale.
projects.details: A distributed orchestration system that schedules and runs containerized jobs across worker nodes. It coordinates cluster state centrally while keeping execution lightweight at the edge.

projects.title: CourseBundler
projects.summary: Full-stack online learning platform deployed on AWS with a Node.js and Express backend, MongoDB plus Redis caching, React frontend, and Terraform-managed infrastructure on ECS Fargate.
highlights: Deployed a full-stack learning platform on AWS using ECS Fargate with Terraform-managed infrastructure.
Backend uses Node.js and Express with MongoDB and Redis caching. Frontend is React.
Production-style deployment workflow with ALB routing, CloudFront, and S3 hosting.
projects.details: A full-stack online learning platform deployed on AWS. Backend runs on ECS Fargate with MongoDB and Redis caching, frontend is React, and infra is managed using Terraform.

projects.title: License Plate Detector
projects.summary: Computer vision workflow for training and running a license plate detector using a notebook-driven pipeline.
highlights: Notebook-based workflow that guides setup, training, and inference for license plate detection.
Clear separation between dataset preparation, model steps, and inference usage.
Designed to be adaptable to different datasets and detection targets.
projects.details: A notebook-driven computer vision project that focuses on detecting license plates from images using a repeatable training and inference workflow.

projects.title: Mental Health Treatment Prediction
projects.summary: Machine learning project that predicts likelihood of seeking mental health treatment using survey data and classification models.
highlights: End-to-end ML workflow including preprocessing, feature encoding, and model evaluation.
Notebook-based experimentation with reproducible results and documented findings.
Packaged results for easy sharing alongside the code.
projects.details: A supervised learning workflow that predicts whether an individual is likely to seek mental health treatment based on survey responses.

projects.title: PortfolioX (Mobile App)
projects.summary: React Native portfolio app with modular navigation and screens, backed by a Node.js API structured with routes, controllers, models, and middleware.
highlights: React Native app organized into screens, navigation, redux, styles, and utilities.
Backend API organized into controllers, routes, models, and middleware for clean separation.
Deployment-ready backend configuration included, plus a hosted endpoint link on the repo.
projects.details: A React Native mobile portfolio app with a structured UI architecture and centralized state. It is supported by a Node.js backend API with conventional layering for maintainability.

projects.title: Realtime Stock Watchlist (Android)
projects.summary: Android watchlist app with real-time quotes, persistent storage, and a clean MVVM architecture.
highlights: Real-time watchlist with quote updates and responsive UI flows.
Offline persistence for watchlist data using a local database.
Layered app design with clear separation between UI, domain, and data.
projects.details: An Android app for tracking stocks with real-time quotes and a persistent watchlist. Built to stay responsive and usable with local caching.

experience.summary: Built and operated distributed investment platform services on GCP, improving deployment speed and reducing infrastructure cost.
highlights: Supported 1,000+ daily active sessions across portfolio and fund analytics workflows.
Reduced monthly infrastructure costs by $2,400 by migrating 15+ cron workloads to serverless.
Cut deployment time by 60% via IaC automation, containers, and CI/CD.

experience.summary: Built low latency order execution services, secured APIs, and automated daily financial data ingestion.
highlights: Cut order execution latency by 80% with a Go worker model using Redis queues.
Secured 220+ API endpoints with JWT-based multi-role access control.
Synced 10,000+ NAV records daily via automated ingestion.

experience.summary: Improved throughput and reliability of Kafka-based C++ pipelines with monitoring, profiling, and performance fixes.
highlights: Sustained 50K+ events per second ingestion from Kafka.
Reduced incident detection time by 70% with Prometheus and Grafana monitoring.
Improved batch throughput by 3x via multithreading and memory pooling.

achievements.title: Ranked 1st in Open Innovation track at MINED Hackathon
Won 6 coding contests and organized 5+ coding events
